intro: Quercus arcaula var. racemosa, commonly known as the racemose oak, is a variant of the arcaula oak characterized by its distinct floral structure. This plant belongs to the Fagaceae family and is native to specific regions in the Mediterranean. It features acorns that are typically clustered in racemes, a unique arrangement that sets it apart from other oak species. The leaves are usually lobed and have a rough, textured surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
